info.description: A corporate action is an event triggered by a public company that changes an equity or fixed income security issued by the company. There are two main categories - Mandatory and Voluntary.
info.title: Aladdin Corporate Action

get.description: Gets a corporate action based on corporate action Id.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
View of corporate action resource.
If not specified, then this parameter will default to the 'CORPORATE_ACTION_VIEW_FULL' value.
(-- api-linter: core::0131::request-unknown-fields=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we need to specify view
 of the resource... --).

 - CORPORATE_ACTION_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED: The default/unset value at API level.
The GetCorporateActions API defaults to FULL and FilterCorporateActions API defaults to DESC_ONLY on cam-server side.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_VIEW_FULL: Includes full contents of the resource.
parameters.name: corporateActionView

post.description:
Filters corporate actions based on search criteria.
Search must be made using at-least any one of these: ids, externalCorporateActionIds, start/endProcessingDate, start/endExpirationDate, start/endModifyTime, assetIds. These can be clubbed (if required) with all available search parameters.
Both start and end date must be provided if making a search using any date/time field.
From the body container, fields that are not required for making a search can be removed from corporateActionQuery object only.
Pagination not supported currently. pagesize & pageToken have to be left as they are.

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

typeDateTime.description:
* When utc_offset is set and time_zone is unset: a civil time on a calendar
   day with a particular offset from UTC.
 * When time_zone is set and utc_offset is unset: a civil time on a calendar
   day in a particular time zone.
 * When neither time_zone nor utc_offset is set: a civil time on a calendar
   day in local time.

The date is relative to the Proleptic Gregorian Calendar.

If year is 0, the DateTime is considered not to have a specific year. month
and day must have valid, non-zero values.

This type is more flexible than some applications may want. Make sure to
document and validate your application's limitations.
typeDateTime.title: Represents civil time in one of a few possible ways:

year.description:
Optional. Year of date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 if specifying a
datetime without a year.

month.description: Required. Month of year. Must be from 1 to 12.

day.description:
Required. Day of month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and
month.

hours.description:
Required. Hours of day in 24 hour format. Should be from 0 to 23. An API
may choose to allow the value "24:00:00" for scenarios like business
closing time.

minutes.description: Required. Minutes of hour of day. Must be from 0 to 59.

seconds.description:
Required. Seconds of minutes of the time. Must normally be from 0 to 59. An
API may allow the value 60 if it allows leap-seconds.

nanos.description:
Required. Fractions of seconds in nanoseconds. Must be from 0 to
999,999,999.

utcOffset.description:
UTC offset. Must be whole seconds, between -18 hours and +18 hours.
For example, a UTC offset of -4:00 would be represented as
{ seconds: -14400 }.

typeTimeZone.description:
Represents a time zone from the
[IANA Time Zone Database](https://www.iana.org/time-zones).

id.description: IANA Time Zone Database time zone, e.g. "America/New_York".

version.description: Optional. IANA Time Zone Database version number, e.g. "2019a".

v1CorporateAction.description:
CorporateActions describes an event triggered by a public company
that changes an equity or fixed income security issued by the company.
There are many different types of corporate action but they can be bucketed
into two main categories - mandatory and voluntary. Mandatory events do not
require any action from the shareholder.
Cash dividends and stocks splits are examples of mandatory corporate action.
Voluntary corporate action are events where shareholders may elect to
participate in the event.
Examples of voluntary events include tender offers and rights subscriptions.

id.description:
Resources must have an 'id' field.

Id describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
String represenation of numeric internal corporate action Id.

corporateActionType.description: Code used to categorize corporate action types.

corporateActionLinkState.description: Link Status of a source to a composite event link.

voluntaryMandatoryCode.description:
Specifies whether the Corporate Action requires a decision, [V]oluntary or
[M]andatory.

corporateActionWorkflowState.description: A corp act status in regard to workflow processing.

assetId.title:
Aladdin asset identifier undergoing corporate action.
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because asset id can be nullable  --)

exDate.description:
First date on which shares are purchased without entitlement to the
corporate action. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

importantDate.description:
Date on a specific corporate action calculated by a specific date per event
type. Used to determine if a corporate action is unique. May be blank. Date
is in Aladdin Server timezone.

effectiveDate.description:
Date on which a corporate action becomes effective. Date is in Aladdin
Server timezone.

corporateActionExpirationTime.description:
Last date/time that an election on an voluntary corporate action can be
executed. Date/Time has an associated timezone.

earlyExpirationTime.description:
The earlier date/time in case of multiple expiration dates may have an impact on
premiums or choice of elections. Date/Time has an associated timezone.

payableDate.description:
The date on which payment or shares are sent to eligible holders. Date is in
Aladdin Server timezone.

recordDate.description:
Date on which ownership is established to determine payment of a
distribution. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

firstSubDate.description:
Subscription begin date. First date on which a rights subscription can be
accepted. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

firstTradeDate.description:
First date on which an entitlement to rights can be sold to another
party. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

lastSubDate.description:
Last Date on which a subscription can be executed. Date is in Aladdin Server
timezone.

lastTradeDate.description:
Last Date on which an entitlement to rights can be sold to another
party. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

processingDate.description:
Aladdin specific date on which the corporate action is processed.
For Events with parent type = 'RES or 'SU' or 'WE', the Processing date =
Effective Date - two business days.
For all other events, processingDate = exDate or ImportantDate. Date is in
Aladdin Server timezone.

tradeEligibilityDate.description:
Aladdin specific date for position to be traded by in order to be eligible
for entitlement. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

settlementEligibilityDate.description:
Aladdin-specific date for position to be settled by in order to be eligible
for entitlement.
Typically populates with due bill off date or recordDate.
If those dates are not available, then exDate -1 , importantDate -1. Date
is in Aladdin Server timezone.

lifecycleStartDate.description:
Aladdin-specific date on which the corporate action event first appears on 
the Dashboard Events Monitor. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

lifecycleEndDate.description:
Aladdin specific date on which the approved corporate action event falls of
the Dashboard Events Monitor.
This date is the latest of (Ex Date/Important Date + 5), (Payable Date +
1), or (Expiration Date + 1).
Derived from source. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

externalIssueDescription.description:
Text information about the security issue. This field is sourced from
external feed.

issuerDescription.title:
Description of the security's issuing company. This field is sourced from
external feed.
(-- aip.dev/beta-blocker: This should reference
    an issuer resource and should use issuer_id instead of
    issuer_description. BackEnd API currently doesn't support issuer id.
    --)

offerorName.description: Name of the company or entity making an offer.

modifier.title:
The user who modified this corporate action.
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this can be nullable  --)

confirmer.title:
The user who confirmed this corporate action.
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this can be nullable  --)

modifyTime.description:
The date/time when this corporate action was last modified. Time is in Aladdin
Server timezone.

confirmTime.description:
The date/time when this corporate action was confirmed. Time is in Aladdin Server
timezone.

minimumTradeSize.description: Minimum number of shares to be exercised to participate.

taxCode.description:
Indicates if there are additional tax terms or documents that a client may
need to refer
to in order to assess the impact of tax on the corporate action.

corporateActionOptions.description:
List of options for this corporate action (only one entry for mandatory
corporate action).
Only one of these can be a default option for a corporate action event.

optionAlignmentState.description:
Tells whether composite and source event differs in option alignment or if
it has been manaully changed and is pending for approval.

externalCorporateActionId.description:
Vendor or custodian-specific reference number to identify corporate action
event.

corporateActionDataSource.description:
Vendor or custodian that provided the corporate action feed.
'COMPOSITE' value represents gold copy of Aladdin Record.

v1CorporateActionLinkState.description:
Enumeration of corporate action link state.

 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_CANCELLED: CANCELLED - 'R'.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_NEAR_MATCH: NEAR_MATCH -'K'.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_MISMATCH: MISMATCH -'M'.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_MULTIPLE_MATCHES: MULTIPLE_MATCHES - 'X'.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_LINK_STATE_PROPOSED: PROPOSED - 'P'.

defaultOption.description:
If 'TRUE', then the option is automatically elected when entitlement holder
makes no election. By default, the value is - 'FALSE'.

recommended.description: Indicates whether the option is recommended.

recommender.title:
Specifies the user who recommended the option.
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this can be nullable  --)

optionDescription.description:
Full desciption of the option.
For some events, additional information may assist in choosing one option
type over another.

payouts.description: List of payouts - cash and security movements comprising this option.

v1CorporateActionQuery.description:
The query required to perform a CorporateActionAPI.FilterCorporateActions
query.

ids.description:
Represents internal corporate action Ids.
If corporate Ids are provided in the search request then all other criteria 
fields would be ignored.

lifecycleDate.description:
Lifecycle date. This date is checked to see if it is between the lifecycle 
start date and end date.
Defaults to today if not specified. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

corporateActionDataSources.description:
Vendor or custodian that provided the corporate action feed.
'COMPOSITE' value represents gold copy of Aladdin Record.

startProcessingDate.description: Start processing date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

endProcessingDate.description: End processing date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

startExpirationDate.description: Start expiration date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

endExpirationDate.title: End expiration date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.”

startPayableDate.description: Start Payable date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

endPayableDate.description: End Payable date. Date is in Aladdin Server timezone.

startModifyTime.description: Start Modify time. Time is in Aladdin Server timezone.

endModifyTime.description: End modify time. Time is in Aladdin Server timezone.

voluntaryMandatoryCode.description: Corporate Action Category  - VM Code [V]oluntary or [M]andatory.

portfolioGroupName.description: Portfolio group containing asset Ids related to corporate action events.

v1CorporateActionView.description:
Enumeration of corporate action views.

 - CORPORATE_ACTION_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED: The default/unset value at API level.
The GetCorporateActions API defaults to FULL and FilterCorporateActions API defaults to DESC_ONLY on cam-server side.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_VIEW_FULL: Includes full contents of the resource.

v1CorporateActionWorkflowState.description:
Enumeration of workflow status.

 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_NEW: NEW.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_UNREVIEWED: UNREVIEWED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_APPROVED: APPROVED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_CANCELLED: CANCELLED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_LOAD_FAILED: LOAD FAILED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_INFO_ONLY: INFORMATION ONLY.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_MERGED: MERGED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_UPDATED: UPDATED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_LINKED: LINKED.
 - CORPORATE_ACTION_WORKFLOW_STATE_UNSUPPORTED: UNSUPPORTED.

corporateActionQuery.title:
Query used to filter CorporateActions.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9016::request-message-query=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the rule postdates the implementation --)

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterCorporateActions' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterCorporateActions' must match the call that provided the page
token.
This value is currently not being used.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of CorporateActions to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 250
CorporateActions will be returned. The maximum value is 250; values
above 250 will be coerced to 250.
This value is currently not being used.

corporateActionView.description: View of Corporate Action Resource to be returned.

corporateActions.description: The entities that match the specified CorporateActionsRequest.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'pageToken' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1OptionAlignmentState.description:
Enumeration of option alignment states.

 - OPTION_ALIGNMENT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - OPTION_ALIGNMENT_STATE_OPTION_MISMATCH: Option mismatch.
 - OPTION_ALIGNMENT_STATE_PENDING_APPROVAL: Pending approval in case state manually changed.

assetId.title:
Aladdin asset identifier. An asset Id may also be assigned to a
portfolio or an index.
(-- api-linter: core::0122::resource-reference-type=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this can be nullable  --)

payoutAmountCurrencyCode.description: Currency of the amount paid out.

payoutPrice.description: Amount to participate in a corporate action.

payoutPriceCurrencyCode.description: Currency of the amount needed to participate in a corporate action.

payoutRate.description: Ratio of security payout based on shares owned.

v1PayoutType.description:
Enumeration of payout types.

 - PAYOUT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_CASH: Cash.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_PRINCIPAL_CASH: Principal Cash.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_DIVIDEND: Dividend.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_INTEREST: Interest.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_SECURITY: Security.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_LONG_TERM_CAPITAL_GAIN: Long Term Capital Gain.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_SHORT_TERM_CAPITAL_GAIN: Short Term Capital Gain.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_FRANKED: Franked.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_UNFRANKED: Unfranked.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_INCOME_DISTRIBUTION: Income Distribution.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_FUND_EQUALIZATION: Fund Equalization.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_MANAGEMENT_FEES: Management Fees.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_OTHER_EXPENSES: Other Expenses.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_TAX_DEFERRED: Tax Deferred.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_TAX_EXEMPTED: Tax Exempted.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_PROPERTY_INCOME_DISTRIBUTION: Property Income Distribution.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_CAPITAL_GAIN_PROPERTY_CONCESSIONAL: Capital Gain Property - Concessional.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_CAPITAL_GAIN_PROPERTY_DISCOUNTED: Capital Gain Property - Discounted.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_CAPITAL_GAIN_PROPERTY_NON_TAX: Capital Gain Property - Non Tax.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_CAPITAL_GAIN_PROPERTY_OTHER: Capital Gain Property - Other.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_FOREIGN_INCOME: Foreign Income.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_ROYALTIES: Royalties.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_TAX_CREDIT: Tax Credit.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_PREMIUM: Premium.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_PRINCIPAL_PAYMENT: Principal Payment.
 - PAYOUT_TYPE_DRIP_CASH_FOR_SECURITY: Drip Cash for Security.

v1TaxCode.description:
Enumeration of tax codes.

 - TAX_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - TAX_CODE_TAXABLE: TAXABLE.
 - TAX_CODE_S302: Section 302.
 - TAX_CODE_NOT_TAXABLE: NON_TAXABLE.

v1VoluntaryMandatoryCode.description:
Enumeration of corporate action category codes.

 - VOLUNTARY_MANDATORY_CODE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value. Default value if not specified.
 - VOLUNTARY_MANDATORY_CODE_VOLUNTARY: Voluntary action.
 - VOLUNTARY_MANDATORY_CODE_MANDATORY: Mandatory action.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.co: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.corporate_action.v1.CorporateAction API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.co: This grants access to all endpoints in the investment_operations.asset_lifecycle.corporate_action.v1.CorporateAction API
scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
